meanings.definition: To drain or siphon off slowly
meanings.sent1: The plant leeched water from the soil to survive.
meanings.sent2: The sponge leeched up all the spilled juice from the table.
meanings.sent3: The thirsty desert seemed to be leeched dry by the scorching sun.
meanings.sent4: The vampire bat leeched the blood from its prey with precision.
meanings.sent5: The old pipe leeched rust into the clear water, turning it orange.

meanings.definition: To attach oneself to someone or something in order to exploit or benefit from them
meanings.sent1: The con artist leeched onto unsuspecting victims for money.
meanings.sent2: The barnacles leeched onto the ship's hull, slowing it down.
meanings.sent3: The lazy coworker always leeched off others' hard work.
meanings.sent4: The fame-seeker leeched onto celebrities to gain attention.
meanings.sent5: The parasite leeched onto the host, draining its energy slowly.

meanings.definition: A person who constantly takes from others without giving anything in return
meanings.sent1: The leeches in the office always ask for help but never offer any in return.
meanings.sent2: The social leeches at the party only wanted free drinks and food.
meanings.sent3: The leech in the group project never did any work but claimed credit.
meanings.sent4: The financial leech always borrowed money but never paid it back.
meanings.sent5: The emotional leech drained positivity from everyone around them.
